contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=January 2009}} {{coord|21|47|48|S|50|52|43|W|scale:30000|display=title}} ''For the Brazilian epidemiologist, see [[Oswaldo Cruz]]. For the neighbourhood in Rio de Janeiro, see [[Oswaldo Cruz (Rio de Janeiro)]].'' '''Osvaldo Cruz''' is a municipality in the [[Brazil]]ian [[Brazilian state|state]] of [[São Paulo (state)|São Paulo]]. The population in 2004 was 30,023 and the area is 248.69 km². The elevation is 485 m. It was founded in 1941 by Max Wirth, a Swiss citizen who immigrated to Brazil searching for new agricultural lands. First named "Nova Califórnia" the small village was created on Guataporanga Farm. [[Category:Populated places in São Paulo (state)]] {{SaoPauloState-geo-stub}}
